metadata.title: CVE-2019-11048 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: In PHP versions 7.2.x below 7.2.31, 7.3.x below 7.3.18 and 7.4.x below7.4.6, when HTTP file uploads are allowed, supplying overly long filenamesor field names could lead PHP engine to try to allocate oversized memorystorage, hit the memory limit and stop processing the request, withoutcleaning up temporary files created by upload request. This potentiallycould lead to accumulation of uncleaned temporary files exhausting the diskspace on the target server.

criterions.comment: php5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
